content:
Does anyone have ideas for what images would convey "I agree" or "working on it"? Could be worth browsing the existing emoji set for good choices, but these are super common reactions to want to convey.

This is a follow-up to the discussion on https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/frontend/topic/hotkeys.2E.2B.
I'd suggest one of these for "working on it":
(Also feel free to suggest something from another icon set, like font-awesome! It's very easy to add custom emoji-like things.)
yeah, great point
We could also potentially design our own
Have we considered adding stickers? They seem to be very popular in instant messaging apps
Is there a free software sticker set we can use?
Hmmm I don't think so. They're like big emoji, though. Maybe we can do some adaptation?
What I've seen in Telegram is that people really like exchanging sticker packs, or even creating their own. It'd be great if we could manage that, although that's probably too much of a hassle

We could certainly support an "upload custom stickers" thing sorta like we support uploading custom emoji. And it'd just provide a nice way to pick from among some pre-uploaded larger images that your organization likes to share.
Might be good to fix how custom emoji work to actually involve uploading the emoji first, though :)
(currently we do it via a link; there's an open issue for this)
You're right, we should probably wait until emoji are fully fixed
Or maybe we should make sure emoji get fully fixed soon. I'll ping @Kirill Kanakhin about that, since he just did the realm icons project :)
I'd do it myself, but I don't want to start anything more until I start finishing other stuff in my TODO
In my opinion, Stickers == Spam.
And I don't think it would fit well into Zulip.
Telegram is mostly for casual chat which is why I think stickers fit well there.
yeah, I'm also not totally onboard with stickers yet

I suppose this may be something that needs to be a setting controllable by organization administrators. I personally think that they are a distraction from effective communication about getting things done, but some communities really like stickers (animate gifs are kinda in the same category).
I love the wrench idea for "working on it"
Yeah, back to the original topic (BTW, generally probably better to use a new topic in the same stream to bring up things like stickers)
Wrench is I think the leading proposal so far :).
